adw.contact.label: Animal Diversity Web technical staff
adw.name: Animal natural history and life history

aeo.contact.label: Jonathan Bard
aeo.description: AEO is an ontology of anatomical structures that expands CARO, the Common Anatomy Reference Ontology
aeo.name: Anatomical Entity Ontology

aero.contact.label: Melanie Courtot
aero.description: The Adverse Event Reporting Ontology (AERO) is an ontology aimed at supporting clinicians at the time of data entry, increasing quality and accuracy of reported adverse events
aero.name: Adverse Event Reporting Ontology

agro.contact.label: Marie-Angélique Laporte
agro.description: Ontology of agronomic practices, agronomic techniques, and agronomic variables used in agronomic experiments
agro.name: Agronomy Ontology

aism.contact.label: Jennifer C. Girón
aism.description: The AISM contains terms used in insect biodiversity research for describing structures of the exoskeleton and the skeletomuscular system. It aims to serve as the basic backbone of generalized terms to be expanded with order-specific terminology.
aism.name: Ontology for the Anatomy of the Insect SkeletoMuscular system (AISM)

amphx.contact.label: Hector Escriva
amphx.description: An ontology for the development and anatomy of Amphioxus (Branchiostoma lanceolatum).
amphx.name: The Amphioxus Development and Anatomy Ontology

apo.contact.label: Stacia R Engel
apo.description: A structured controlled vocabulary for the phenotypes of Ascomycete fungi
apo.name: Ascomycete phenotype ontology

apollo_sv.contact.label: Mathias Brochhausen
apollo_sv.description: Defines terms and relations necessary for interoperation between epidemic models and public health application software that interface with these models
apollo_sv.name: Apollo Structured Vocabulary

bcgo.contact.label: Jie Zheng
bcgo.description: An application ontology built for beta cell genomics studies.
bcgo.name: Beta Cell Genomics Ontology

bco.contact.label: Ramona Walls
bco.description: An ontology to support the interoperability of biodiversity data, including data on museum collections, environmental/metagenomic samples, and ecological surveys.
bco.name: Biological Collections Ontology

bfo.contact.label: Barry Smith
bfo.description: The upper level ontology upon which OBO Foundry ontologies are built.
bfo.name: Basic Formal Ontology

bspo.contact.label: Chris Mungall
bspo.description: An ontology for representing spatial concepts, anatomical axes, gradients, regions, planes, sides, and surfaces
bspo.name: Biological Spatial Ontology

bto.contact.label: Christian-Alexander Dudek
bto.description: A structured controlled vocabulary for the source of an enzyme comprising tissues, cell lines, cell types and cell cultures.
bto.name: BRENDA tissue / enzyme source

caro.contact.label: Melissa Haendel
caro.description: An upper level ontology to facilitate interoperability between existing anatomy ontologies for different species
caro.name: Common Anatomy Reference Ontology

cdao.contact.label: Jim Balhoff
cdao.description: a formalization of concepts and relations relevant to evolutionary comparative analysis
cdao.name: Comparative Data Analysis Ontology

cdno.contact.label: Liliana Andres Hernandez
cdno.description: CDNO provides structured terminologies to describe nutritional attributes of material entities that contribute to human diet.
cdno.name: Compositional Dietary Nutrition Ontology

ceph.contact.label: Chris Mungall
ceph.description: An anatomical and developmental ontology for cephalopods
ceph.name: Cephalopod Ontology

chebi.contact.label: Adnan Malik
chebi.description: A structured classification of molecular entities of biological interest focusing on 'small' chemical compounds.
chebi.name: Chemical Entities of Biological Interest

cheminf.contact.label: Egon Willighagen
cheminf.description: Includes terms for the descriptors commonly used in cheminformatics software applications and the algorithms which generate them.
cheminf.name: Chemical Information Ontology

chiro.contact.label: Nicole Vasilevsky
chiro.description: CHEBI provides a distinct role hierarchy. Chemicals in the structural hierarchy are connected via a 'has role' relation. CHIRO provides links from these roles to useful other classes in other ontologies. This will allow direct connection between chemical structures (small molecules, drugs) and what they do. This could be formalized using 'capable of', in the same way Uberon and the Cell Ontology link structures to processes.
chiro.name: CHEBI Integrated Role Ontology

chmo.contact.label: Colin Batchelor
chmo.description: CHMO, the chemical methods ontology, describes methods used to
chmo.name: Chemical Methods Ontology

cido.contact.label: Yongqun Oliver He
cido.description: The Coronavirus Infectious Disease Ontology (CIDO) aims to ontologically represent and standardize various aspects of coronavirus infectious diseases, including their etiology, transmission, epidemiology, pathogenesis, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment.
cido.name: Coronavirus Infectious Disease Ontology

cio.contact.label: Frédéric Bastian
cio.description: An ontology to capture confidence information about annotations.
cio.name: Confidence Information Ontology

cl.contact.label: Alexander Diehl
cl.description: The Cell Ontology is a structured controlled vocabulary for cell types in animals.
cl.name: Cell Ontology

clao.contact.label: Luis González-Montaña
clao.description: CLAO is an ontology of anatomical terms employed in morphological descriptions for the Class Collembola (Arthropoda: Hexapoda).
clao.name: Collembola Anatomy Ontology

clo.contact.label: Sirarat Sarntivijai
clo.description: An ontology to standardize and integrate cell line information and to support computer-assisted reasoning.
clo.name: Cell Line Ontology

clyh.contact.label: Lucas Leclere
clyh.description: The Clytia hemisphaerica Development and Anatomy Ontology (CLYH) describes the anatomical and developmental features of the Clytia hemisphaerica life cycle.
clyh.name: Clytia hemisphaerica Development and Anatomy Ontology

cmo.contact.label: Jennifer Smith
cmo.description: Morphological and physiological measurement records generated from clinical and model organism research and health programs.
cmo.name: Clinical measurement ontology

cob.contact.label: Bjoern Peters
cob.description: COB brings together key terms from a wide range of OBO projects to improve interoperability.
cob.name: Core Ontology for Biology and Biomedicine

colao.contact.label: Jennifer C. Giron
colao.description: The Coleoptera Anatomy Ontology contains terms used for describing the anatomy and phenotype of beetles in biodiversity research. It has been built using the Ontology Develoment Kit, with the Ontology for the Anatomy of the Insect Skeleto-Muscular system (AISM) as a backbone.
colao.name: Coleoptera Anatomy Ontology (COLAO)

cro.contact.label: Marijane White
cro.description: A classification of the diverse roles performed in the work leading to a published research output in the sciences. Its purpose to provide transparency in contributions to scholarly published work, to enable improved systems of attribution, credit, and accountability.
cro.name: Contributor Role Ontology

cteno.contact.label: Chris Mungall
cteno.description: An anatomical and developmental ontology for ctenophores (Comb Jellies)
cteno.name: Ctenophore Ontology

cto.contact.label: Dr. Alpha Tom Kodamullil
cto.description: The core Ontology of Clinical Trials (CTO) will serve as a structured resource integrating basic terms and concepts in the context of clinical trials. Thereby covering clinicaltrails.gov. CoreCTO will serve as a basic ontology to generate extended versions for specific applications such as annotation of variables in study documents from clinical trials.
cto.name: CTO: Core Ontology of Clinical Trials

cvdo.contact.label: Paul Fabry
cvdo.description: An ontology to describe entities related to cardiovascular diseases
cvdo.name: Cardiovascular Disease Ontology

ddanat.contact.label: Petra Fey
ddanat.description: A structured controlled vocabulary of the anatomy of the slime-mold Dictyostelium discoideum
ddanat.name: Dictyostelium discoideum anatomy

ddpheno.contact.label: Petra Fey
ddpheno.description: A structured controlled vocabulary of phenotypes of the slime-mould Dictyostelium discoideum.
ddpheno.name: Dictyostelium discoideum phenotype ontology

dideo.contact.label: Mathias Brochhausen
dideo.description: The Potential Drug-drug Interaction and Potential Drug-drug Interaction Evidence Ontology
dideo.name: Drug-drug Interaction and Drug-drug Interaction Evidence Ontology

dinto.contact.label: Maria Herrero
dinto.description: A formal represention for drug-drug interactions knowledge.
dinto.name: The Drug-Drug Interactions Ontology

disdriv.contact.label: Lynn Schriml
disdriv.description: Ontology for drivers and triggers of human diseases, built to classify ExO ontology exposure stressors. An application ontology. Built in collaboration with EnvO, ExO, ECTO and ChEBI.
disdriv.name: Disease Drivers Ontology

doid.contact.label: Lynn Schriml
doid.description: An ontology for describing the classification of human diseases organized by etiology.
doid.name: Human Disease Ontology

dpo.contact.label: Clare Pilgrim
dpo.description: An ontology of commonly encountered and/or high level Drosophila phenotypes.
dpo.name: Drosophila Phenotype Ontology

dron.contact.label: William Hogan
dron.description: An ontology to support comparative effectiveness researchers studying claims data.
dron.name: The Drug Ontology

duo.contact.label: Melanie Courtot
duo.description: DUO is an ontology which represent data use conditions.
duo.name: Data Use Ontology

ecao.contact.label: Charles Ettensohn
ecao.description: An ontology for the development and anatomy of the different species of the phylum Echinodermata (NCBITaxon:7586).
ecao.name: The Echinoderm Anatomy and Development Ontology

eco.contact.label: Michelle Giglio
eco.description: An ontology for experimental and other evidence statements.
eco.name: Evidence ontology

ecocore.contact.label: Pier Luigi Buttigieg
ecocore.description: Ecocore is a community ontology for the concise and controlled description of ecological traits of organisms.
ecocore.name: An ontology of core ecological entities

ecto.contact.label: Anne Thessen
ecto.description: ECTO describes exposures to experimental treatments of plants and model organisms (e.g. exposures to modification of diet, lighting levels, temperature); exposures of humans or any other organisms to stressors through a variety of routes, for purposes of public health, environmental monitoring etc, stimuli, natural and experimental, any kind of environmental condition or change in condition that can be experienced by an organism or population of organisms on earth. The scope is very general and can include for example plant treatment regimens, as well as human clinical exposures (although these may better be handled by a more specialized ontology).
ecto.name: Environmental conditions, treatments and exposures ontology

ehdaa2.contact.label: Jonathan Bard
ehdaa2.description: A structured controlled vocabulary of stage-specific anatomical structures of the developing human.
ehdaa2.name: Human developmental anatomy, abstract

emap.contact.label: Terry Hayamizu
emap.description: A structured controlled vocabulary of stage-specific anatomical structures of the mouse (Mus).
emap.name: Mouse gross anatomy and development, timed

emapa.contact.label: Terry Hayamizu
emapa.description: An ontology for mouse anatomy covering embryonic development and postnatal stages.
emapa.name: Mouse Developmental Anatomy Ontology

envo.contact.label: Pier Luigi Buttigieg
envo.description: Ontology of environmental features and habitats
envo.name: Environment Ontology

eo.contact.label: Pankaj Jaiswal
eo.description: A structured, controlled vocabulary which describes the treatments, growing conditions, and/or study types used in plant biology experiments.
eo.name: Plant Environment Ontology

epio.contact.label: Alpha Tom Kodamullil
epio.description: A application driven Epilepsy Ontology with official terms from the ILAE.
epio.name: Epilepsy Ontology

epo.description: An ontology designed to support the semantic annotation of epidemiology resources
epo.name: Epidemiology Ontology

ero.contact.label: Marc Ciriello
ero.description: An ontology of research resources such as instruments. protocols, reagents, animal models and biospecimens.
ero.name: eagle-i resource ontology

eupath.contact.label: Chris Stoeckert
eupath.description: An ontology is developed to support Eukaryotic Pathogen, Host & Vector Genomics Resource (VEuPathDB; https://veupathdb.org).
eupath.name: VEuPathDB ontology

exo.contact.label: Cynthia Grondin
exo.description: Vocabularies for describing exposure data to inform understanding of environmental health.
exo.name: Exposure ontology

fao.contact.label: Val Wood
fao.description: A structured controlled vocabulary for the anatomy of fungi.
fao.name: Fungal gross anatomy

fbbi.contact.label: Willy Wong
fbbi.description: A structured controlled vocabulary of sample preparation, visualization and imaging methods used in biomedical research.
fbbi.name: Biological Imaging Methods Ontology

fbbt.contact.label: Clare Pilgrim
fbbt.description: An ontology representing the gross anatomy of Drosophila melanogaster.
fbbt.name: Drosophila gross anatomy

fbcv.contact.label: Clare Pilgrim
fbcv.description: A structured controlled vocabulary used for various aspects of annotation by FlyBase.
fbcv.name: FlyBase Controlled Vocabulary

fbdv.contact.label: Clare Pilgrim
fbdv.description: A structured controlled vocabulary of the development of Drosophila melanogaster.
fbdv.name: Drosophila development

fbsp.contact.label: Clare Pilgrim
fbsp.description: The taxonomy of the family Drosophilidae (largely after Baechli) and of other taxa referred to in FlyBase.
fbsp.name: Fly taxonomy

fideo.contact.label: Georgeta Bordea
fideo.description: Food-Drug interactions automatically extracted from scientific literature
fideo.name: Food Interactions with Drugs Evidence Ontology

fix.contact.label: chEBI
fix.description: An ontology of physico-chemical methods and properties.
fix.name: Physico-chemical methods and properties

flopo.contact.label: Robert Hoehndorf
flopo.description: Traits and phenotypes of flowering plants occurring in digitized Floras
flopo.name: Flora Phenotype Ontology

fma.contact.label: Onard Mejino
fma.description: This is currently a slimmed down version of FMA
fma.name: Foundational Model of Anatomy Ontology (subset)

fobi.contact.label: Pol Castellano Escuder
fobi.description: FOBI (Food-Biomarker Ontology) is an ontology to represent food intake data and associate it with metabolomic data
fobi.name: Food-Biomarker Ontology

foodon.contact.label: Damion Dooley
foodon.description: A broadly scoped ontology representing entities which bear a “food role”. It encompasses materials in natural ecosystems and agriculture that are consumed by humans and domesticated animals. This includes any generic (unbranded) raw or processed food material found in processing plants, markets, stores or food distribution points. FoodOn also imports nutritional component and dietary pattern terms from other OBO Foundry ontologies to support interoperability in diet and nutrition research
foodon.name: Food Ontology

fovt.contact.label: Meghan Balk
fovt.description: FuTRES Ontology of Vertebrate Traits is an application ontology used to convert vertebrate trait data in spreadsheet to triples. FOVT leverages the BioCollections Ontology (BCO) to link observations of individual specimens to their trait values. Traits are defined in the Ontology of Biological Attributes (OBA).
fovt.name: FuTRES Ontology of Vertebrate Traits

fypo.contact.label: Val Wood
fypo.description: FYPO is a formal ontology of phenotypes observed in fission yeast.
fypo.name: Fission Yeast Phenotype Ontology

gaz.contact.label: Lynn Schriml
gaz.description: A gazetteer constructed on ontological principles
gaz.name: Gazetteer

gecko.contact.label: Rebecca Jackson
gecko.description: An ontology to represent genomics cohort attributes
gecko.name: Genomics Cohorts Knowledge Ontology

genepio.contact.label: Damion Dooley
genepio.description: The Genomic Epidemiology Ontology (GenEpiO) covers vocabulary necessary to identify, document and research foodborne pathogens and associated outbreaks.
genepio.name: Genomic Epidemiology Ontology

geno.contact.label: Matthew Brush
geno.description: An integrated ontology for representing the genetic variations described in genotypes, and their causal relationships to phenotype and diseases.
geno.name: Genotype Ontology

gno.contact.label: Nathan Edwards
gno.description: GlyTouCan provides stable accessions for glycans described at varyious degrees of characterization, including compositions (no linkage) and topologies (no carbon bond positions or anomeric configurations). GNOme organizes these stable accessions for interative browsing, for text-based searching, and for automated reasoning with well-defined characterization levels.
gno.name: Glycan Naming and Subsumption Ontology (GNOme)

go.contact.label: Suzi Aleksander
go.description: An ontology for describing the function of genes and gene products
go.name: Gene Ontology

gsso.contact.label: Clair Kronk
gsso.description: The Gender, Sex, and Sexual Orientation (GSSO) ontology has terms for annotating interdisciplinary information concerning gender, sex, and sexual orientation for primary usage in the biomedical and adjacent sciences.
gsso.name: Gender, Sex, and Sexual Orientation (GSSO) ontology

hancestro.contact.label: Danielle Welter
hancestro.description: The Human Ancestry Ontology (HANCESTRO) provides a systematic description of the ancestry concepts used in the NHGRI-EBI Catalog of published genome-wide association studies.
hancestro.name: Human Ancestry Ontology

hao.contact.label: Matt Yoder
hao.description: A structured controlled vocabulary of the anatomy of the Hymenoptera (bees, wasps, and ants)
hao.name: Hymenoptera Anatomy Ontology

hom.contact.label: Frederic Bastian
hom.description: This ontology represents concepts related to homology, as well as other concepts used to describe similarity and non-homology.
hom.name: Homology Ontology

hp.contact.label: Sebastian Koehler
hp.description: A structured and controlled vocabulary for the phenotypic features encountered in human hereditary and other disease.
hp.name: Human Phenotype Ontology

hso.contact.label: Fernanda Dorea
hso.description: The health Surveillance Ontology (HSO) focuses on "surveillance system level data", that is, data outputs from surveillance activities, such as number of samples collected, cases observed, etc. It aims to support One-Health surveillance, covering animal health, public health and food safety surveillance.
hso.name: Health Surveillance Ontology

htn.contact.label: Amanda Hicks
htn.description: An ontology for representing clinical data about hypertension, intended to support classification of patients according to various diagnostic guidelines
htn.name: Hypertension Ontology

iceo.contact.label: Meng LIU
iceo.description: ICEO is an integrated biological ontology for the description of bacterial integrative and conjugative elements (ICEs).
iceo.name: Integrative and Conjugative Element Ontology

ico.contact.label: Yongqun Oliver He
ico.description: An ontology of clinical informed consents
ico.name: Informed Consent Ontology

ido.contact.label: Lindsay Cowell
ido.description: A set of interoperable ontologies that will together provide coverage of the infectious disease domain. IDO core is the upper-level ontology that hosts terms of general relevance across the domain, while extension ontologies host terms to specific to a particular part of the domain.
ido.name: Infectious Disease Ontology

idomal.contact.label: Pantelis Topalis
idomal.description: An application ontology to cover all aspects of malaria as well as the intervention attempts to control it.
idomal.name: Malaria Ontology

imr.contact.label: INOH curators
imr.name: Molecule role (INOH Protein name/family name ontology)

ino.contact.label: Yongqun Oliver He
ino.description: An ontology of interactions and interaction networks
ino.name: Interaction Network Ontology

kisao.contact.label: Jonathan Karr
kisao.description: A classification of algorithms for simulating biology and their outputs
kisao.name: Kinetic Simulation Algorithm Ontology

labo.contact.label: Paul Fabry
labo.description: LABO is an ontology of informational entities formalizing clinical laboratory tests prescriptions and reporting documents.
labo.name: clinical LABoratory Ontology

lepao.contact.label: Luis A. Gonzalez-Montana
lepao.description: The Lepidoptera Anatomy Ontology contains terms used for describing the anatomy and phenotype of moths and butterflies in biodiversity research. LEPAO is developed in part by BIOfid (The Specialised Information Service Biodiversity Research).
lepao.name: Lepidoptera Anatomy Ontology

lipro.contact.label: Christipher Baker
lipro.description: An ontology representation of the LIPIDMAPS nomenclature classification.
lipro.name: Lipid Ontology

ma.contact.label: Terry Hayamizu
ma.description: A structured controlled vocabulary of the adult anatomy of the mouse (Mus).
ma.name: Mouse adult gross anatomy

mamo.contact.label: Nicolas Gambardella
mamo.description: The Mathematical Modelling Ontology (MAMO) is a classification of the types of mathematical models used mostly in the life sciences, their variables, relationships and other relevant features.

maxo.contact.label: Leigh Carmody
maxo.description: Medical Action Ontology is an ontology...
maxo.name: Medical Action Ontology

mco.contact.label: Citlalli Mejía-Almonte
mco.description: Microbial Conditions Ontology is an ontology...
mco.name: Microbial Conditions Ontology

mf.contact.label: Janna Hastings
mf.description: The Mental Functioning Ontology is an overarching ontology for all aspects of mental functioning.

mfmo.contact.label: Robert Druzinsky
mfmo.description: The Mammalian Feeding Muscle Ontology is an antomy ontology for the muscles of the head and neck that participate in feeding, swallowing, and other oral-pharyngeal behaviors.
mfmo.name: Mammalian Feeding Muscle Ontology

mfo.contact.label: Thorsten Henrich
mfo.description: A structured controlled vocabulary of the anatomy and development of the Japanese medaka fish, Oryzias latipes.
mfo.name: Medaka fish anatomy and development

mfoem.contact.label: Janna Hastings
mfoem.description: An ontology of affective phenomena such as emotions, moods, appraisals and subjective feelings.

mfomd.contact.label: Janna Hastings
mfomd.description: An ontology to describe and classify mental diseases such as schizophrenia, annotated with DSM-IV and ICD codes where applicable
mfomd.name: Mental Disease Ontology

mi.contact.label: Pablo Porras Millán
mi.description: A structured controlled vocabulary for the annotation of experiments concerned with protein-protein interactions.

miapa.contact.label: Hilmar Lapp
miapa.description: An application ontology to formalize annotation of phylogenetic data.

micro.contact.label: Carrine Blank

mirnao.contact.label: Pantelis Topalis
mirnao.description: An application ontology for use with miRNA databases.
mirnao.name: microRNA Ontology

miro.description: Application ontology for entities related to insecticide resistance in mosquitos

mmo.contact.label: Jennifer Smith

mondo.contact.label: Nicole Vasilevsky

nbo.name: Neuro Behavior Ontology

ncbitaxon.contact.label: Frederic Bastian
ncbitaxon.description: An ontology representation of the NCBI organismal taxonomy
ncbitaxon.name: NCBI organismal classification

ncit.contact.label: Melissa Haendel
ncit.description: NCI Thesaurus (NCIt)is a reference terminology that includes broad coverage of the cancer domain, including cancer related diseases, findings and abnormalities. The NCIt OBO Edition aims to increase integration of the NCIt with OBO Library ontologies. NCIt OBO Edition releases should be considered experimental.
ncit.name: NCI Thesaurus OBO Edition

ncro.contact.label: Jingshan Huang
ncro.description: An ontology for non-coding RNA, both of biological origin, and engineered.

nmr.contact.label: Schober Daniel
nmr.description: Descriptors relevant to the experimental conditions of the Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR) component in a metabolomics investigation.

nomen.contact.label: Matt Yoder
nomen.description: NOMEN is a nomenclatural ontology for biological names (not concepts).  It encodes the goverened rules of nomenclature.

oae.contact.label: Yongqunh He
oae.description: A biomedical ontology in the domain of adverse events
oae.name: Ontology of Adverse Events

oarcs.contact.label: Matt Yoder
oarcs.description: OArCS is an ontology describing the Arthropod ciruclatory system.
oarcs.name: Ontology of Arthropod Circulatory Systems

oba.contact.label: Chris Mungall
oba.description: A collection of biological attributes (traits) covering all kingdoms of life.
oba.name: Ontology of Biological Attributes

obcs.contact.label: Jie Zheng
obcs.description: A biomedical ontology in the domain of biological and clinical statistics.
obcs.name: Ontology of Biological and Clinical Statistics

obi.contact.label: Bjoern Peters
obi.description: An integrated ontology for the description of life-science and clinical investigations
obi.name: Ontology for Biomedical Investigations

obib.contact.label: Jie Zheng
obib.description: An ontology built for annotation and modeling of biobank repository and biobanking administration

ogg.contact.label: Yongqun Oliver He

ogi.description: An ontology that formalizes the genomic element by defining an upper class genetic interval

ogms.contact.label: Brian Aevermann

ogsf.contact.label: Asiyah Yu Lin

ohd.contact.label: Bill Duncan
ohd.description: The Oral Health and Disease Ontology was created, initially, to represent the content of dental practice health records.
ohd.name: Oral Health and Disease Ontology

ohmi.contact.label: Yongqun Oliver He
ohmi.description: The Ontology of Host-Microbiome Interactions aims to ontologically represent and standardize various entities and relations related to microbiomes, microbiome host organisms (e.g., human and mouse), and the interactions between the hosts and microbiomes at different conditions.
ohmi.name: Ontology of Host-Microbiome Interactions

ohpi.contact.label: Edison Ong
ohpi.description: OHPI is a community-driven ontology of host-pathogen interactions (OHPI) and represents the virulence factors (VFs) and how the mutants of VFs in the Victors database become less virulence inside a host organism or host cells. It is developed to represent manually curated HPI knowledge available in the PHIDIAS resource.
ohpi.name: Ontology of Host Pathogen Interactions

omiabis.contact.label: Mathias Brochhausen
omiabis.description: An ontological version of MIABIS (Minimum Information About BIobank data Sharing)

omit.contact.label: Jingshan Huang
omit.description: Ontology to establish data exchange standards and common data elements in the microRNA (miR) domain
omit.name: Ontology for MIRNA Target

omo.contact.label: Chris Mungall
omo.description: An ontology specifies terms that are used to annotate ontology terms for all OBO ontologies. The ontology was developed as part of Information Artifact Ontology (IAO).
omo.name: OBO Metadata Ontology

omp.contact.label: James C. Hu
omp.description: An ontology of phenotypes covering microbes
omp.name: Ontology of Microbial Phenotypes

omrse.contact.label: Bill Hogan
omrse.description: This ontology covers the domain of social entities that are related to health care, such as demographic information and the roles of various individuals and organizations.
omrse.name: Ontology of Medically Related Social Entities

one.contact.label: Chen Yang
one.description: An ontology to standardize research output of nutritional epidemiologic studies.
one.name: Ontology for Nutritional Epidemiology

ons.contact.label: Francesco Vitali
ons.description: An ontology for description of concepts in the nutritional studies domain.
ons.name: Ontology for Nutritional Studies

ontoavida.contact.label: Miguel A. Fortuna
ontoavida.description: OntoAvida develops an integrated vocabulary for the description of the most widely-used computational approach for studying evolution using digital organisms (i.e., self-replicating computer programs that evolve within a user-defined computational environment).
ontoavida.name: OntoAvida: ontology for Avida digital evolution platform

ontoneo.contact.label: Fernanda Farinelli
ontoneo.description: The Obstetric and Neonatal Ontology is a structured controlled vocabulary to provide a representation of the data from electronic health records (EHRs) involved in the care of the pregnant woman, and of her baby.
ontoneo.name: Obstetric and Neonatal Ontology

oostt.contact.label: Mathias Brochhausen
oostt.description: An ontology built for representating the organizational components of trauma centers and trauma systems.
oostt.name: Ontology of Organizational Structures of Trauma centers and Trauma systems

opl.contact.label: Jie Zheng
opl.description: A reference ontology for parasite life cycle stages.
opl.name: Ontology for Parasite LifeCycle

opmi.contact.label: Yongqun Oliver He
opmi.description: The Ontology of Precision Medicine and Investigation (OPMI) aims to ontologically represent and standardize various entities and relations associated with precision medicine and related investigations at different conditions.
opmi.name: Ontology of Precision Medicine and Investigation

ornaseq.contact.label: Stephen Fisher
ornaseq.description: An application ontology designed to annotate next-generation sequencing experiments performed on RNA.
ornaseq.name: Ontology of RNA Sequencing

ovae.contact.label: Yongqunh He
ovae.description: A biomedical ontology in the domain of vaccine adverse events.
ovae.name: Ontology of Vaccine Adverse Events

pato.contact.label: George Gkoutos
pato.description: An ontology of phenotypic qualities (properties, attributes or characteristics)
pato.name: Phenotype And Trait Ontology

pcl.contact.label: David Osumi-Sutherland
pcl.description: Cell types that are provisionally defined by experimental techniques such as single cell or single nucleus transcriptomics rather than a straightforward & coherent set of properties.
pcl.name: Provisional Cell Ontology

pco.contact.label: Ramona Walls
pco.description: An ontology about groups of interacting organisms such as populations and communities
pco.name: Population and Community Ontology

pdro.contact.label: Paul Fabry
pdro.description: An ontology to describe entities related to prescription of drugs
pdro.name: The Prescription of Drugs Ontology

pdumdv.contact.label: Frédéric Bastian
pdumdv.description: Life cycle stages for Platynereis dumerilii
pdumdv.name: Platynereis Developmental Stages

peco.contact.label: Pankaj Jaiswal
peco.description: A structured, controlled vocabulary which describes the treatments, growing conditions, and/or study types used in plant biology experiments.
peco.name: Plant Experimental Conditions Ontology

phipo.contact.label: Alayne Cuzick
phipo.description: PHIPO is a formal ontology of species-neutral phenotypes observed in pathogen-host interactions.
phipo.name: Pathogen Host Interaction Phenotype Ontology

plana.contact.label: Sofia Robb
plana.description: PLANA, the planarian anatomy ontology, encompasses the anatomy and life cycle stages for both __Schmidtea mediterranea__ biotypes.
plana.name: planaria-ontology

planp.contact.label: Sofia Robb
planp.description: Planarian Phenotype Ontology is an ontology of phenotypes observed in the planarian Schmidtea mediterranea.
planp.name: Planarian Phenotype Ontology

po.contact.label: Pankaj Jaiswal
po.description: The Plant Ontology is a structured vocabulary and database resource that links plant anatomy, morphology and growth and development to plant genomics data.
po.name: Plant Ontology

poro.contact.label: Bob Thacker
poro.description: An ontology covering the anatomy of the taxon Porifera (sponges)
poro.name: Porifera Ontology

ppo.contact.label: Ramona Walls
ppo.description: An ontology for describing the phenology of individual plants and populations of plants, and for integrating plant phenological data across sources and scales.
ppo.name: Plant Phenology Ontology

pr.contact.label: Darren Natale
pr.description: An ontological representation of protein-related entities
pr.name: PRotein Ontology (PRO)

psdo.contact.label: Zach Landis-Lewis
psdo.description: Ontology to reproducibly study visualizations of clinical performance
psdo.name: Performance Summary Display Ontology

pw.contact.label: G. Thomas Hayman
pw.description: A controlled vocabulary for annotating gene products to pathways.
pw.name: Pathway ontology

rbo.contact.label: Daniel C. Berrios
rbo.description: RBO is an ontology for the effects of radiation on biota in terrestrial and space environments.
rbo.name: Radiation Biology Ontology

resid.contact.label: John Garavelli
resid.description: For the description of covalent bonds in proteins.
resid.name: Protein covalent bond

rex.description: An ontology of physico-chemical processes, i.e. physico-chemical changes occurring in course of time.
rex.name: Physico-chemical process

rnao.contact.label: Colin Batchelor
rnao.description: Controlled vocabulary pertaining to RNA function and based on RNA sequences, secondary and three-dimensional structures.
rnao.name: RNA ontology

ro.contact.label: Chris Mungall
ro.description: Relationship types shared across multiple ontologies
ro.name: Relation Ontology

rxno.contact.label: Colin Batchelor
rxno.description: Connects organic name reactions to their roles in an organic synthesis and to processes in MOP
rxno.name: Name Reaction Ontology

sbo.contact.label: Rahuman Sheriff
sbo.description: Terms commonly used in Systems Biology, and in particular in computational modeling.
sbo.name: Systems Biology Ontology

scdo.contact.label: Jade Hotchkiss
scdo.description: An ontology for the standardization of terminology and integration of knowledge about Sickle Cell Disease.
scdo.name: Sickle Cell Disease Ontology

sep.contact.label: SEP developers via the PSI and MSI mailing lists
sep.description: A structured controlled vocabulary for the annotation of sample processing and separation techniques in scientific experiments.
sep.name: Sample processing and separation techniques

sepio.contact.label: Matthew Brush
sepio.description: An ontology for representing the provenance of scientific claims and the evidence that supports them.
sepio.name: Scientific Evidence and Provenance Information Ontology

so.contact.label: Karen Eilbeck
so.description: A structured controlled vocabulary for sequence annotation, for the exchange of annotation data and for the description of sequence objects in databases.
so.name: Sequence types and features ontology

spd.contact.label: Martin Ramirez
spd.description: An ontology for spider comparative biology including anatomical parts (e.g. leg, claw), behavior (e.g. courtship, combing) and products (i.g. silk, web, borrow).
spd.name: Spider Ontology

stato.contact.label: Alejandra Gonzalez-Beltran
stato.description: STATO is a general-purpose STATistics Ontology. Its aim is to provide coverage for processes such as statistical tests, their conditions of application, and information needed or resulting from statistical methods, such as probability distributions, variables, spread and variation metrics. STATO also covers aspects of experimental design and description of plots and graphical representations commonly used to provide visual cues of data distribution or layout and to assist review of the results.
stato.name: The Statistical Methods Ontology

swo.contact.label: Allyson Lister
swo.description: The Software Ontology (SWO) is a resource for describing software tools, their types, tasks, versions, provenance and associated data. It contains detailed information on licensing and formats as well as software applications themselves, mainly (but not limited) to the bioinformatics community.
swo.name: Software ontology

symp.contact.label: Lynn Schriml
symp.description: An ontology of disease symptoms, with symptoms encompasing perceived changes in function, sensations or appearance reported by a patient indicative of a disease.
symp.name: Symptom Ontology

tads.contact.label: Daniel Sonenshine
tads.description: The anatomy of the Tick, Families: Ixodidae, Argassidae
tads.name: Tick Anatomy Ontology

tahe.contact.label: Pierre Sprumont
tahe.name: Terminology of Anatomy of Human Embryology

tahh.contact.label: Pierre Sprumont
tahh.name: Terminology of Anatomy of Human Histology

tao.contact.label: Wasila Dahdul
tao.description: Multispecies fish anatomy ontology. Originally seeded from ZFA, but intended to cover terms relevant to other taxa
tao.name: Teleost Anatomy Ontology

taxrank.contact.label: Jim Balhoff
taxrank.description: A vocabulary of taxonomic ranks (species, family, phylum, etc)
taxrank.name: Taxonomic rank vocabulary

tgma.contact.label: Pantelis Topalis
tgma.description: A structured controlled vocabulary of the anatomy of mosquitoes.
tgma.name: Mosquito gross anatomy ontology

to.contact.label: Pankaj Jaiswal
to.description: A controlled vocabulary to describe phenotypic traits in plants.
to.name: Plant Trait Ontology

trans.contact.label: Lynn Schriml
trans.description: An ontology representing the disease transmission process during which the pathogen is transmitted directly or indirectly from its natural reservoir, a susceptible host or source to a new host.
trans.name: Pathogen Transmission Ontology

tto.contact.label: Jim Balhoff
tto.description: An ontology covering the taxonomy of teleosts (bony fish)
tto.name: Teleost taxonomy ontology

txpo.contact.label: Yuki Yamagata
txpo.description: TOXic Process Ontology (TXPO) systematizes a wide variety of terms involving toxicity courses and processes. The first version of TXPO focuses on liver toxicity.
txpo.name: Toxic Process Ontology

uberon.contact.label: Chris Mungall
uberon.description: An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology covering animals and bridging multiple species-specific ontologies
uberon.name: Uberon multi-species anatomy ontology

uo.contact.label: George Gkoutos
uo.description: Metrical units for use in conjunction with PATO
uo.name: Units of measurement ontology

upa.contact.label: Anne Morgat
upa.description: A manually curated resource for the representation and annotation of metabolic pathways
upa.name: Unipathway

upheno.contact.label: Nicole Vasilevsky
upheno.description: The uPheno ontology integrates multiple phenotype ontologies into a unified cross-species phenotype ontology.
upheno.name: Unified phenotype ontology (uPheno)

vario.contact.label: Mauno Vihinen
vario.description: Variation Ontology, VariO, is an ontology for standardized, systematic description of effects, consequences and mechanisms of variations.
vario.name: Variation Ontology

vo.contact.label: Yongqunh He
vo.description: VO is a biomedical ontology in the domain of vaccine and vaccination.
vo.name: Vaccine Ontology

vt.contact.label: Carissa Park
vt.description: An ontology of traits covering vertebrates
vt.name: Vertebrate trait ontology

vto.contact.label: Jim Balhoff
vto.description: Comprehensive hierarchy of extinct and extant vertebrate taxa.
vto.name: Vertebrate Taxonomy Ontology

wbbt.contact.label: Raymond Lee
wbbt.description: A structured controlled vocabulary of the anatomy of Caenorhabditis elegans.
wbbt.name: C. elegans Gross Anatomy Ontology

wbls.contact.label: Chris Grove
wbls.description: A structured controlled vocabulary of the development of Caenorhabditis elegans.
wbls.name: C. elegans development ontology

wbphenotype.contact.label: Chris Grove
wbphenotype.description: A structured controlled vocabulary of Caenorhabditis elegans phenotypes
wbphenotype.name: C. elegans phenotype

xao.contact.label: Erik Segerdell
xao.description: XAO represents the anatomy and development of the African frogs Xenopus laevis and tropicalis.
xao.name: Xenopus Anatomy Ontology

xco.contact.label: Jennifer Smith
xco.description: Conditions under which physiological and morphological measurements are made both in the clinic and in studies involving humans or model organisms.
xco.name: Experimental condition ontology

xlmod.contact.label: Lutz Fischer
xlmod.description: A structured controlled vocabulary for cross-linking reagents used with proteomics mass spectrometry.
xlmod.name: HUPO-PSI cross-linking and derivatization reagents controlled vocabulary

xpo.contact.label: Erik Segerdell
xpo.description: XPO represents anatomical, cellular, and gene function phenotypes occurring throughout the development of the African frogs Xenopus laevis and tropicalis.
xpo.name: Xenopus Phenotype Ontology

zeco.contact.label: Yvonne Bradford
zeco.description: Experimental conditions applied to zebrafish, developed to facilitate experiment condition annotation at ZFIN
zeco.name: Zebrafish Experimental Conditions Ontology

zfa.contact.label: Ceri Van Slyke
zfa.description: A structured controlled vocabulary of the anatomy and development of the Zebrafish
zfa.name: Zebrafish anatomy and development ontology

zp.contact.label: Yvonne Bradford
zp.description: The Zebrafish Phenotype Ontology formally defines all phenotypes of the Zebrafish model organism.
zp.name: Zebrafish Phenotype Ontology
